result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diana M Remington

Defendant Diana M Remington in court.  Attorney Sarah Zwach in court for Diana M Remington.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court ordered case DISMISSED but read in for purposes of sentencing in case #21CF4657.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Diana M Remington in court.  Attorney Sarah Zwach in court for Diana M Remington.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-14-2022

Defendant Diana M Remington in court with attorney Sarah Zwach.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 07-06-2022

Defendant Diana M Remington in court with attorney Sarah Zwach.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for an arraignment hearing.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court addressed Justice Point violations.  No action taken at this time. Defense requests a status date.  Court set matter as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 06-01-2022
Pretrial Services Supervision (VIOLATION-Missed Office Contact) Report; filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Hampton Inn and D.W.S.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Case adjourned for arraignment in Branch 40.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.

Defendant Diana M Remington in court with Attorney Sarah Zwach.  Defendant Diana M Remington in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.   Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings.  Initial appearance proceeded.  Arraignment scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Proposed No Contact Order.
Received and Filed.

Attorney Sarah Zwach in court, defendant Diana M Remington not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference following case #21CF4657.  Doctor's report return remains scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
received and filed.
received and filed.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Diana M Remington in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Diana M Remington in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Diana M Remington appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to Branch 40 due to Lower number case pending. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
